Articles.Content: The white floor markings in SPH & VAB appear pixelated and they flicker madly. Is anyone else having the same issue?
Hi @kurja, KSP on Linux has some trouble with some textures, but this is varies from driver to driver, what gpu driver are you using?

7 minutes ago, sal_vager said:

Hi @kurja, KSP on Linux has some trouble with some textures, but this is varies from driver to driver, what gpu driver are you using?

nvidia-352 (.63)
Hmm, I'm on nvidia-358, on a GTX650 if that helps.

46 minutes ago, sal_vager said:

Hmm, I'm on nvidia-358, on a GTX650 if that helps.

Tried nvidia-367 (.44), but to no effect. Same flicker.
What are your settings in the nvidia panel? If the image quality is set too low it might cause this.

Hm I haven't really touched those ever, in nvidia x server open gl settings gui there's a slider that was set at "quality", I set it to "high quality" which is as far as it went, doing this didn't help with the texture glitch though.

I have also been having this bug since 1.2, and it's still present in 1.2.1.  I'm running KSP64 on linux (arch, linux 4.8.4-1, 64bit).  GPU is a GTX 580, driver version is currently 370.28 (though I'm pretty sure I've updated the driver at least a couple of times since the problem started).  I've tried playing with "image quality" settings, with no impact on the issue.  There also seems to be some other minor texture glitches that look like Z-fighting to me (particularly around the launch pad in the main KSC view) that I don't remember from 1.1 and earlier.
There's a longstanding (but maybe not related) bug on Windows where if you look straight down at the floor, the markings disappear.

I was wondering if anyone has a solution this problem?

I'm getting the same bug with flickering textures, the most obvious is the one in the VAB as per the screenshot in the first post.

I'm using

  • Linux Ubuntu 16.04
  • NVIDIA GTX1070 Driver version 381.22
  • Default settings in nvidia-settings
  • KSP 1.3.0.1804 with default settings, no mods.
  • Default Video settings in KSP

EDIT: There seems to be a much more recent post about this problem, here, so I'm rather going to reply to that thread: 

 

Edited June 23, 2017 by Dalden
Added link to more recent post
Since there's a new thread for this, locking the old one since it's likely not super relevant now (is from a prior version of KSP.)
